Class DisplayDialogBoxes

  • java.lang.Object
    • DisplayDialogBoxes

  • public class DisplayDialogBoxes
extends java.lang.Object
    The DisplayDialogBoxes class displays the different dialog boxes used in this application.
    Since:
    2016-10-01
    Version:
    v1.0.0
    Author:
    Stephen McFarlane

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisplayDialogBoxes()
      Default constructor for the class that initializes all the private variables to some default value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void exitProgram()
      exitProgram is the dialog box that is used to exit the application.
      java.lang.String getFilePath()
      getFilePath is the getter that can be called to return the private variable filePath.
      java.lang.String loginPrompt()
      loginPrompt is probably the main method that the program uses.
      void setButtonText(java.lang.String buttonText)
      setButtonText is the setter to set the text of the buttons in the pop up dialog box.

      setFilePath is a setter method that updates the private filed filePath.
      void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
      setMessage is the setter to set the private message variable that is used to display a message in the pop up box.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayDialogBoxes

        public DisplayDialogBoxes()
        Default constructor for the class that initializes all the private variables to some default value.

        These are the private variables and there data types.

        • message - empty string
        • buttonText - empty string
        • filePath - empty string
        • validatePassword - new AuthenticationSecurity instance.

    • Method Detail

      • setFilePath

        public void setFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
        setFilePath is a setter method that updates the private filed filePath.
        Parameters:
        filePath - This is the path to the file location on disk.

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        getFilePath is the getter that can be called to return the private variable filePath.
        Returns:
        This returns a string with the filePath.

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        setMessage is the setter to set the private message variable that is used to display a message in the pop up box.
        Parameters:
        message - This is the text to show up in the dialog box pop up.

      • setButtonText

        public void setButtonText(java.lang.String buttonText)
        setButtonText is the setter to set the text of the buttons in the pop up dialog box.
        Parameters:
        buttonText - This is the actual text for the buttons on the pop up dialog.

      • exitProgram

        public void exitProgram()
        exitProgram is the dialog box that is used to exit the application. This can be called because they logged in to many times or the successfully logged in and got the system information.

        This uses the private variables:

        • message
        • buttonText

      • loginPrompt

        public java.lang.String loginPrompt()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        loginPrompt is probably the main method that the program uses. It is the first thing the main method calls when it starts.

        This method calls these following methods:

        • RequestFocusListener
        • setValidPassword
        • getValidPassword
        • invalidUsernamePassword
        The private variables used in this method are:
        • fielPath
        Returns:
        Returns three options:
        • username - if it validates the password successfully.
        • "exit" - if the user cancels the login request.
        • "" - empty string if it does not fine the username or password.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - Gives an exception if the file does not exists.
